content: If block proposers are also stateless they wouldn't need to store shard state at all. Users will be required to attach witnesses to their txes

content:
this post provides a good overview imo on this topic:
https://ethresear.ch/t/state-provider-models-in-ethereum-2-0/6750
but basically yeah, some 3rd party entities store the whole state and provide proofs on request to users. Not sure what you mean by optimistically accepted? they prove the parts of the state that are needed for a given tx against the current state root

author: 0xalizk
content: Thanks <@!259648573401071617> , optimistically accepted in the sense that the block producer may be including a valid but stale state for example, which can be included but it can also be detected and the bp punished later (same flow as optimistic rollups)
